articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Songchongang Net-weaving Factory and Plastic Tube Shop
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Songchongang Net-weaving Factory and Plastic Tube Shop
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Songchongang Net-weaving Factory and the Plastic Tube Shop newly built by the 1521 Enterprise of the Korean People's Army.
					 He looked round the monument to the field guidance of leader Kim Jong Il to the factory dated August 23, 1982 erected to convey his immortal leadership exploits down through generations and the room dedicated to its history.
					
					 The first leg of his visit was the Songchongang Net-weaving Factory.
					
					 He initiated the building of a modern net-weaving factory and assigned the task to the 1521 Enterprise under KPA Unit 600. 
					
					 He went round the exterior of the factory after being briefed on it before a map showing the net and rope production processes.
					
					 Feasting his eyes on the building of the factory with a broad smile, he was very pleased to note that it was built in a peculiar style and designed to meet the requirements of contemporary architectural beauty. It is such a fashionable factory that no one can say it is a production establishment, he added.
					
					 He made the rounds of various production processes of the factory to learn in detail about its construction and technical equipment and production. 
					
					 He highly appreciated the feats performed by the builders, noting that the factory capable of mass-producing varieties of nets with less manpower is a precious treasure of the country as it was constructed well and cultural practice in production is at a high level. 
					
					 He said he was pleased to know that nets are great in their tensile strength, high in extension rate and very durable.
					
					 Learning about the toughness and use of ropes produced at the factory, he underscored the need to mass-produce ropes whose demand is great everywhere.
					
					 If the factory reenergizes production by minutely conducting business management and activities, it can bring it to a higher level in a brief span of time, he noted, stressing the need to exchange technology with the Taedonggang Net-weaving Factory and earnestly learn from its good experience.
					
					 Saying he was very pleased to visit the Songchongang Net-weaving Factory, he added that it is now possible to mass-produce varieties of nets as it pleases.
					
					 The next leg of his visit was the Plastic Tube Shop newly built at the 1521 Enterprise of the KPA.
					
					 After being briefed on the shop before a map showing the plastic tube production process, he saw various sizes of plastic tubes produced at the shop.
					
					 Going round the large and small size plastic tube production process, he learned in detail about the specifications of the equipment and quality of products.
					
					 Looking round its cultural hall, he asked how many employees the shop has and if it can accommodate all of them. It is as good as an art theatre as it is well furnished with seats and other facilities, he noted.
					
					 Watching with keen attention various forms of visual boards on the walls of its corridor, he said it is important to conduct well the education of the employees in the revolution, class and socialist patriotism. He underscored the need to make such education places prove effective.
					
					 He had a photo session with the employees of the enterprise.
					
					 Making a bird's-eye view of the net-weaving factory again and again with a broad smile, he said the longer one watches it, the nicer it looks. He proposed taking another picture with workers with the factory for a background.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Jong Nam, Son Chol Ju, Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Majon Bathing Resort
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Majon Bathing Resort
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Majon Bathing Resort.
					 Going round the resort, he looked back with deep emotion on the leadership exploits performed by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il there.
					
					 He said that they were tender-hearted fathers of the people who visited every place for the happiness of the people and provided cultural recreation grounds for people in every scenic spot.
					
					 After being told by officials of the field concerned that a shower site, sea observation tower, rest home, restaurant for bathers and others were built and now being used, he asked if the accommodating capacity of the buildings of the rest home can meet the demands of visitors to the resort.
					
					 He asked whether the bathing resort is not hit by typhoon and tsunami and learned in detail about how many people visit that place in summer season.
					
					 Hearing officials say that people not only from Hamhung City but Pyongyang City visit the resort and citizens of Hamhung, in particular, make it part of their life to visit there more than three times in a year, he said it is nice to hear that. This suffices to know well how strongly our people wish to lead a cultural and emotional life, he added.
					
					 He stressed that it is important for glorifying the leadership exploits of the Generalissimos and providing our people with a happier life to spruce up the bathing resort at a world level as required by the new century.
					
					 Our officials should have a standpoint and style to take upon themselves tasks for the good of people and go down to spots to help find solutions to issues, he said.
					
					 He told the officials to build modern public service facilities such as bathing booths and shower rooms when rebuilding the resort.
					
					 He also instructed them to build facilities that make the pine forest clearly distinct from the beach.
					
					 He underscored the need for the officials of the relevant unit and the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK to bear deep in mind the importance of the reconstruction of the bathing resort and make good preparations for it from now, start it in real earnest from coming autumn and wind it up by next summer so that our people may fully enjoy bathing in the newly built world class resort.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Jong Nam, Son Chol Ju, Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Table Tennis Gold Medalists Feted
articles.content:
Table Tennis Gold Medalists Feted 
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet hosted a reception in honor of Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong, gold medalists at the 52nd ITTF World Championships (individual events) and their coach Kim Chol Ung, at Okryu Restaurant on Friday. 
					 Present at the reception were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea (WPK); Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet; Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports; officials concerned, sportspersons and families of the players.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin in his congratulatory speech warmly welcomed Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong who bagged gold medals at the mixed doubles of the world championships, fully demonstrating the dignity and spirit of Songun Korea. 
					
					 Their success clearly proved the validity and vitality of the sports policy of the WPK and encouraged all the service personnel and people of the DPRK in their drive for building a thriving socialist nation, he noted, adding:
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un has shown profound loving care for the players and coach who have returned home after exalting the honor of the country at the championships. 
					
					 The speaker called upon all the sportspersons to uphold the party and glorify the country by bagging more gold medals. 
					
					 Then Kim Jong in her reply speech extended thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un for having granted the greatest privilege to them though they did what they should do as sportspersons in the era of Songun. 
					
					 She renewed her pledge to live up to the loving care and trust of the Marshal with greater successes in games.

articles.title: Wreaths Placed before Grave of Ri Po Ik
articles.content:
Wreaths Placed before Grave of Ri Po Ik
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of Ri Po Ik, the grandmother of President Kim Il Sung, in Mangyongdae on Friday on the occasion of the 137th anniversary of her birth.
					 A wreath from the dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, was seen before her grave.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Mun Kyong Dok and officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and other people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Wreaths were placed in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, military academies and media institutions, organs of the party and power and co-op farms in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Ri Po Ik, Kim Il Sung's Grandmother
articles.content:
Ri Po Ik, Kim Il Sung's Grandmother
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Ri Po Ik (May 31, 1876-October 18, 1959), grandmother of President Kim Il Sung, devoted her all to the struggle against the Japanese invaders, putting the destiny of the country and the nation above anything else.
					 She actively helped her family members in their revolutionary activities, undergoing all sorts of hardships and mental sufferings.
					
					 When her eldest son Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, passed away, she told her eldest grandson Kim Il Sung: "Jungson (grandson), you will have to take over the burden your father was carrying now. You must pick up the cause where he left off and win back the country, come what may. You may have no chance to take care of me or your mother, as is your filial duty, but you must give yourself heart and soul to the cause of Korea's independence."
					
					 Recalling her remarks, the President in his reminiscences "With the Century" said: "I was deeply moved by her words. If she had told me instead to aim for wealth or a successful career, I would not have been as inspired."
					
					 Ri Po Ik never yielded to any coercive power or injustice forced by the enemies.
					
					 As part of the campaign for the surrender of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, the Japanese imperialists dragged her away from Mangyongdae and took her to the area of Mt. Paektu where Kim Il Sung was carrying on an anti-Japanese armed struggle, subjecting her to all kinds of cruelties.
					
					 Whenever the enemy poked her in the back with a rifle butt to make her call out her grandson's name, she retorted, "I don't know how to blabber wild nonsense like that. Anyway, do you think you can kill me and get off scot-free? Go ahead, kill me if you want to end up with my grandson's bullet in your skulls!"
					
					 She was neither a communist nor a professional revolutionary but merely an old countrywoman who had never been to school, never received revolutionary education from an organization, and never even learned to read or write.
					
					 What made her stand up to the enemy so stately and conduct herself so wisely and honorably is ardent patriotism, strong sense of justice and indomitable mental power.

articles.title: Pyongyang International Football School Opens
articles.content:
Pyongyang International Football School Opens
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang International Football School opened with due ceremony on Friday.
					 The school will give children with aptitude for football all opportunities of learning. It will also invite able foreign football experts and will be opened to children from other countries who would like to study at the school. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and others.
					
					 Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made an opening address. Then followed speeches.
					
					 Speakers said the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un named the school "Pyongyang International Football School" and showed warm loving care for its students.
					
					 They called on the students to study and train hard to become ace football players who would glorify the country with high technique.
					
					 After being briefed on the school, the participants visited the class at work.

articles.title: Ice Hockey Matches of National Youth Championship Close
articles.content:
Ice Hockey Matches of National Youth Championship Close 
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Ice hockey matches of the National Youth Championship closed in the DPRK on Thursday. The league matches started on May 15.
					 Men players of the Sports Team of the Pyongyang Railway Bureau and women players of the Taesongsan Sports Team placed first respectively.
					
					 Men players of Korea University of Physical Education and women players of Sajabong Sports Team took the second while men players of the Taesongsan Sports Team and women players of the Sports Team of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex the third.

articles.title: Sports Games Gain Momentum in DPRK
articles.content:
Sports Games Gain Momentum in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Sports contests in various events take place frequently in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Among those finished up till now were Paektusan Prize and Mangyongdae Prize sports games, a short-track speed skating tournament (junior), a rally cycling and the first-stage 39th National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize.
					
					 The 50th National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools are taking place in various parts of the country, with nearly 40 events involved.
					
					 A premier soccer league is now under way in Pyongyang as part of the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize.
					
					 Ice hockey matches for the National Youth Championship took place at the Ice Rink from May 15 to 18. 
					
					 Sports contests have been also held among employees of ministries, national institutions, organs of various levels and industrial establishments. The events include volleyball, basketball and table tennis.
					
					 Courts of volleyball, basketball and tennis, built in Pyongyang and local cities of the country, are bustling with games of students and other citizens almost every day. 
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK athletes have proved successful at international tournaments.
					
					 Kim Kum Ok won a gold medal at the 14th Asian Marathon Championship held in Hong Kong and Hong Kuk Hyon came first in the men's 73kg category at the 2013 Asian Judo Championship and Pak Yong Mi in the women's 48kg freestyle at the 2013 Asian Wrestling Championship.
					
					 Gymnasts Jong Kum Hwa and Kim Hye Song bagged gold medals at the 8th Asian Acrobatic Gymnastic Championship.
					
					 Paddlers Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong won gold medals in the mixed doubles of the 52nd ITTF World Championships (individual events) while Ri Chung Il garnered a gold medal at the international boxing tournament named after Konstantin Korotkov.

articles.title: Nonsmoking Campaign Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Nonsmoking Campaign Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Nonsmoking campaign is gaining momentum in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Some days ago, a workshop on tobacco control took place in the capital city of Pyongyang, with attendance of officials of the Ministry of Public Health, the Education Commission, the Ministry of Commerce and other related units and representatives of international agencies here.
					
					 High on the agenda at the workshop were a series of shortcomings found in combating smoking as well as the ways for overcoming them. The participants also watched a video on nonsmoking activities now under way worldwide.
					
					 In line with the world's tendency to make tobacco-free century, the DPRK enforced the tobacco control law and has paid big efforts to that effect.
					
					 Nonsmoking research centers, set up in Pyongyang and two provinces, are working to raise awareness of harmfulness of tobacco among local people. Put on sale at the centers are anti-smoking pill, anti-smoking gum, denicotinizing pipe, filter, etc.
					
					 On the occasion of World No Tobacco Day, various events took place here on Thursday under the theme "Comprehensive ban on all tobacco advertising, promotion and sponsorship."

articles.title: U.S. Military Pressure to Contain China Increases: News Analyst
articles.content:
U.S. Military Pressure to Contain China Increases: News Analyst
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The contradiction between China and the U.S. is growing acute as the days go by due to the U.S. persistent military pressure to contain China and its strong reaction to this.
					 These days the U.S. is now becoming vocal criticizing China. 
					
					 The U.S. Department of Defense in its 2013 "report on Chinese military and security posture development" presented to Congress accused the Chinese government and army of cyber hacking against the government institutions and enterprises of the U.S.
					
					 In the wake of the publication of the report, U.S. high-ranking officials and media accused China, claiming it lacks transparency in its military modernization as evidenced by Beijing's spending of more funds for defence than what was made public and its consequences are a matter of concern.
					
					 The U.S. escalation of its criticism of China since its transfer of strategic pivot to the Asia-Pacific region has sparked off a strong rebuff of the army and government of China.
					
					 The Chinese People's Liberation Army flatly brushed aside the U.S. accusation as it failed to produce evidence enough to prove the China's involvement in cyber hacking.
					
					 A spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry warned that the U.S. repeated mud-slinging would adversely affect the relations between the two countries.
					
					 The U.S. is now plugging its satellite forces in the Asia-Pacific region into its operation to contain China.
					
					 UPI reported the U.S. administration allowed Japan to deploy drones on Guam in a bid to turn it into an important strategic outpost in  operations against China and agreed with Tokyo to jointly monitor the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Pentagon formally informed Congress that it would sell to south Korea four Global Hawks used in Afghanistan, etc. 
					
					 China is taking countermeasures against the U.S. moves to knock into shape an alliance against China with its satellite forces. 
					
					 The Pentagon asserted that China began deploying Dongfeng-21D missile with a range of 1 500 km, grumbling that the deployment of this missile reportedly tasked to mainly strike enemy's aircraft carriers would be a grave threat to the U.S. in its operations in Asia and Western Pacific.
					
					 Washington did not hide its concern that China put its first aircraft carrier Liaoning into commission and is mulling building other carriers and increase the number of nuclear-powered submarines to eight to the maximum from the present three in the 15 years to come.
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army staged drills of its northern sea fleet made up of a missile destroyer, a missile escort ship and an ocean-going combined supply ship in the Western Pacific and other waters on May 25.
					
					 Observers predict that the military stand-off between the two countries will get more serious in the days ahead.

articles.title: U.S. High-handed, Arbitrary Practices Should Not Be Tolerated: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. High-handed, Arbitrary Practices Should Not Be Tolerated: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined article says that the high-handed and arbitrary practices of the imperialists and their moves for domination should never be allowed in the world.
					 High-handed and arbitrary practices serve as a key means for the U.S. in carrying out its policy for aggression, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. regards political and economic pressure and military tyranny as a key means for expanding the sphere of domination and making other countries obey to it. Military tyranny is the main one here.
					
					 The U.S. high-handed and arbitrary practices have reached their height in the international arena today.
					
					 In January this year the U.S. prodded the UN Security Council into cooking up a "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK over its satellite launch in last December. It faked up another "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK over its underground nuclear test which was carried out in reaction to the "sanctions".
					
					 The U.S. foments territorial, racial, religious and other disputes in different parts of the world and expands aggression and interference by mobilizing powerful military muscle under the pretexts of settling the disputes.
					
					 The U.S. high-handed and arbitrary practices are vividly manifested in dealing with international issues with double standards.
					
					 The U.S. persistent moves to realize its ambition for world hegemony with high-handed and arbitrary practices will precipitate its ruin.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Drop Policy for Confrontation with Compatriots
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Drop Policy for Confrontation with Compatriots
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities' constant policy for confrontation is a root cause of the downgraded inter-Korean relations and escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article:
					
					 The ultimate purpose sought by the puppet forces in their policy for confrontation with fellow countrymen is a "change" in the DPRK and "unification under the liberal democratic system" and this, therefore, has become a major factor of the distrust and confrontation and the war crisis that had mounted between the north and the south. 
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have been strained as the days went by, not an inch away from the catastrophic situation that lasted for the past five years. This is entirely ascribable to the puppet authorities' extreme confrontation policy.
					
					 What they seek is to realize their ambition for "unification of social systems" at any cost by steadily intensifying the moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK in league with outside forces.
					
					 It is because of such group of traitors who are finding a way out in the confrontation with compatriots, quite indifferent to the nation's destiny that there created a serious hurdle in the cause of the country's reunification and all Koreans have been exposed to the constant danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly want to see trust, dialogue and mended relations, they should roll back their confrontation policy and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan Military Drills against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan Military Drills against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The 5th Division of the south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage an exercise to counter a local provocation in the area of Ryonchon, Kyonggi Province from June 3 to 5, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 This exercise will activate huge forces including soldiers of the division, tanks, firepower weapons, local self-governing bodies and police.
					
					 In the same period the 11th Motorized Infantry Division of the south Korean puppet army is going to wage a mobile drill for enhancing the combat operational capacity in the areas of Hongchon and Hwachon, south Korean Kangwon Province by mobilizing helicopters and other offensive weapons.
					
					 The above-said war moves betray the deceptive nature of "dialogue" touted by the south Korean puppet forces and their aggressive design against the DPRK.

articles.title: Japan's Apology for Past Crimes Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Apology for Past Crimes Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- South Korean women's organizations held the 1 076th rally for a solution to the sexual slavery issue in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Wednesday. They included the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps and the Federation of Women Organizations and victims of wartime sexual slavery.
					 Speakers at the rally accused the Japanese politicians including Osaka Mayor Hashimoto of letting loose a string of outbursts justifying the past crimes committed by Japan. They went on:
					
					 The outbursts denying the past crimes of Japan which forced a great number of women into the sexual slavery can never be tolerated as they are a provocation justifying the violence against women.
					
					 Japan denying the past crimes in spite of the existence of victims will be isolated from the international community.
					
					 The Japanese government would be well advised to apologize for its past crimes and opt for legal reparation as soon as possible.
					
					 On the same day the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century held an interview and denounced the Japanese government for openly embellishing its past crimes and reviving militarism.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Reckless Remarks Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Reckless Remarks Flayed
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on Wednesday denounced the reckless remarks of the chief executive.
					 She, addressing the meeting of senior secretaries of Chongwadae on Monday, said that the time job is important in ensuring 70 percent employment rate and it is necessary to make the public realize that the 4-5 hour time job done out of one's own need is a good one, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 Such remarks can be made only by a person confined oneself to one's own office, ignorant of how things go about in the world.
					
					 A time worker is faced with the poorest conditions among part-time workers and even the law on working standard is not applied to those persons working for a short time.
					
					 A time lecturer of Chosun University committed suicide in 2010, leaving a note "I am not a slave".
					
					 Even the university lecturer that sounds ideal as "good time job" is pushed to death. It is needless to say about the plight of other time jobbers.
					
					 There is no tender-hearted capitalist willing to increase good time jobs as there are part-time jobs from which he can get longer working hours with low pay.
					
					 Such a concept may be found in one's mind but never in reality under the worst employment structure as now.
					
					 As a deer cannot become a horse though it is called so, the misunderstanding of the situation by the "president" does not lead to a change.
					
					 The "president's" remarks about "good time job" can be made only by the one who has never earned living wages with one's own hands.
					
					 "Public cognition that the time job is a good one" spelled out by the chief executive leaves one skeptical as to whether she tries to tell a whopping lie as Hitler who let loose sophism.
					
					 The south Korean regime is increasingly bringing hurt to the people.

articles.title: All-Korean Celebration of June 15 Supported by Koreans in China
articles.content:
All-Korean Celebration of June 15 Supported by Koreans in China
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration released a statement on May 24.
					 Noting the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration proposed holding an all-Korean event for reunification on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, the statement actively supported the patriotic proposal.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations, which had advanced toward reconciliation, unity, independent reunification, peace and prosperity since the north-south summit in 2000, plunged into a total deadlock after the emergence of the Lee Myung Bak's regime, and have now sunk to their lowest ebb, a brink of a war, the statement recalled, adding:
					
					 Such facts bring home to all the Koreans the value of the June 15 joint declaration and urgency of its implementation.
					
					 The present "government" of south Korea should ensure without any precondition the participation of the pro-reunification patriotic organizations including the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in the joint event of the nation for implementing the June 15 joint declaration which would be held in the first year of its tenure of office.
					
					 This will be a litmus paper testing the true intention of the south Korean regime toward the implementation of the joint declaration.
					
					 The Chinese Regional Committee will make all its efforts to successfully ensure the joint event of the nation for reunification on behalf of all Koreans in China who desire for national reconciliation and unity and independent reunification of the country under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Website of Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Website of Swiss Organization
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website the full text of the report and conclusion made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the March, 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on May 22.
					 Clarified in the report and the conclusion made by him on March 31, Juche 102 (2013) is the new strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force as required by the prevailing situation and the developing Korean revolution as well as the tasks and ways for carrying them out.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Deterrent Praised by Brazilian Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Deterrent Praised by Brazilian Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- Brazilian organizations posted on their websites articles supporting the Korean people's just cause.
					 The Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il issued an article titled "Justice always wins" on May 24.
					
					 The article said the DPRK's successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 in last December was very just as it was in full concordance with international law on using space for peaceful purposes.
					
					 Saying that a professional institution of the U.S., a country hostile toward the DPRK, officially recognized the DPRK's successful satellite launch, the article accused the U.S. of faking up a "resolution on sanctions" by instigating the UN Security Council.
					
					 The danger of a nuclear war has increased on the Korean Peninsula as the UNSC blindly followed the U.S. high-handed and arbitrary practices bereft of fairness and discretion, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent is a means for self-defence to cope with the ever-more intensified U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threat, and serves as a treasured sword of justice to defend the sovereignty and peace of the country and the nation.
					
					 The world people desirous of justice and progress are on the side of the Korean people who turned out in the struggle to defend independence and justice against the U.S. and its allies being bent on the high-handed and arbitrary practices.
					
					 Victory is on the side of justice and the Korean people all out in the struggle to defend their sovereignty.
					
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article of the similar content on its website on May 23.

articles.title: Indonesian Political Party Supports DPRK
articles.content:
Indonesian Political Party Supports DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- The Pioneer Party of Indonesia issued a statement on May 24 to support the Korean people's just cause to defend the country's sovereignty.
					 The statement said:
					
					 A touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula due to the U.S. maneuvers to violate the sovereignty and vital interests of the DPRK.
					
					 It is a dereliction of duty quite contrary to international law on acknowledging each sovereign state's right to use space for peaceful purposes that the UN Security Council adopted a "resolution" denying the DPRK the right to satellite launch.
					
					 The U.S. inflicted massive physical nuclear threat upon the DPRK in collusion with its satellite countries by flying nuclear strategic strike means in the sky above the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 To cope with this, the DPRK had no other choice but to take tough countermeasures for self-defence.
					
					 The Pioneer Party of Indonesia extends full support to the DPRK's countermeasures, regarding them as just ones.
					
					 It will positively join the Koreans in their struggle to defend the sovereignty and vital interests.

articles.title: Songun Korea Has Bright Future: World Public
articles.content:
Songun Korea Has Bright Future: World Public
						
 Pyongyang, May 31 (KCNA) -- World public is convinced of the bright and rosy future of Songun Korea in the cheerful appearance of children of the DPRK growing up in happiness, being called the king of the country.
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event, the Nepali paper Arpan and La Prosperite, the paper of Democratic Congo, said that the whole life of President Kim Il Sung was a dedication of loving care for the rising generations, and the Songun politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il was all related with deep loving care for the children.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK and the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea posted on their websites articles which said the loving care of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union and the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute in their joint statement noted that Kim Jong Un made a congratulatory speech at the event marking the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union, a vivid expression of his noblest outlook on the future and posterity.
					
					 The Indian paper New Delhi Times said world public is convinced of the bright future of Korea in Kim Jong Un's deep loving care for the children.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy also posted an article on its website. It said the future of the Korean children is very bright, adding that they will dynamically advance toward the final victory under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Teatro al Aire Libre Juventud de Songdowon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Teatro al Aire Libre Juventud de Songdowon
						
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Teatro al Aire Libre Juventud de Songdowon.
					El Mariscal paso revista a la sala de presentacion del historial.
					
					Recordo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il habia dicho que presenciaria la funcion del Coro Estatal Benemerito junto con los ciudadanos de Wonsan cuando se incrementara a 5 mil la capacidad del teatro, pero no cumplio esa promesa.
					
					En el Teatro al Aire Libre Juventud de Songdowon esta impregnado el ardiente amor de los grandes Generalisimos por el pueblo, senalo y destaco que es preciso cuidarlo bien y normalizar la gestion para glorificar generacion tras generacion las hazanas de los Generalisimos.
					
					Puesto que la sala de presentacion del historial es el lugar de educacion para las masas, hay que fijar adecuadamente el lugar y acondicionarlo bien para que lo visiten muchos trabajadores, jovenes y ninos, apunto.
					
					El Mariscal recorrio varios puntos del teatro.
					
					Al sentarse en un asiento de espectador, calculo la altura de silla e instruyo instalarlas para que los usuarios no se sientan incomodos.
					
					Al contemplar el techo en forma de ball trust, instalado sobre la escena, el Mariscal dijo que al principio no habia el techo, pero se instalo de nuevo de acuerdo con la instruccion del Dirigente, y evaluo que lo han hecho bien.
					
					Tras hacer conocimiento de uso del teatro, el Mariscal subrayo que en esta escena deben ofrecer siempre canciones y bailes y realizar la propaganda y agitacion conmovedoras y anadio que sacaria el tiempo para presenciar junto con los ciudadanos de Wonsan la funcion artistica que se ofrezca en este teatro.
					
					El Comite del PTC en la provincia de Kangwon, la Union de la Juventud y otras organizaciones de masas deben prestar profunda atencion a la administracion del teatro para que este cumpla con su mision, acoto.
					
					Presento las tareas y los remedios para acondicionar el teatro como el excelente que juegue bien con el ambiente periferico y el perfecto tambien en el futuro.
					
					Ese dia, el Mariscal tomo una foto de recuerdo junto con los empleados del teatro.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el primer subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Hwi, y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Thae Song y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Songchongang Net-weaving Factory and Plastic Tube Shop
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon
						
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon.
					El Mariscal estuvo primero en la estatua de bronce del Presidente Kim Il Sung, erguida en el recinto del campamento. 
					
					El Mariscal recordo que en 1959, tiempo posbelico, el Presidente escogio el solar del campamento y despues el Dirigente Kim Jong Il hizo reconstruirlo y lo visito en marzo de 1993 cuando la patria se encontraba en una situacion severa. 
					
					Dijo que el partido tiene la firme decision de remodelar magnificamente el campamento donde estan impregnadas las hazanas de direccion de esos grandes Generalisimos de acuerdo con las demandas del nuevo siglo.
					
					Transmitamos para siempre el noble amor del Presidente y el Dirigente por las generaciones venideras al erguir nuevamente las estatuas de bronce de estos grandes hombres encontrandose juntos con los ninos.
					
					Pasando revista al edificio principal y la casa infantil de amistad internacional, visitados por el Dirigente el 30 de marzo de 1993, y otros lugares, el Mariscal dio las instrucciones detalladas que se presentan en la reconstruccion del campamento.
					
					Recorriendo la habitacion no. 221 visitada por el Dirigente y otras del edificio principal, dijo instalar los muebles mejores y televisores.
					
					Hay que empapelar la pared con los papeles de diversos colores y dibujos convenientes a la psicologia infantil y asegurar bien la calefaccion y la electricidad para que los campistas no sientan la incomodidad, destaco.
					
					En el hall del edificio principal, el Mariscal puntualizo que como resultado de la minuciosa direccion del Dirigente, este campamento, construido hace 20 anos, no tiene defectos en lo estetico y arquitectonico.
					
					En la casa infantil de amistad internacional, instruyo instalar las tablas escritas con idioma oficial internacional para el confort de los campistas extranjeros.
					
					Recorriendo la sala de divulgacion de conocimientos maritimos, insistio en poner los especimenes para que los campistas asimilen no solo los conocimientos maritimos sino los de fauna y flora.
					
					En el futuro, pongamos en funcionamiento el campamento tambien en invierno para que los ninos puedan esquiar en el campo de esqui Masikryong, que se construye nuevamente, recalco.
					
					En la piscina y el lugar para paseo en bote, el Mariscal prometio enviar las instalaciones modernas para juegos acuaticos y exhorto a acondicionarlos magnificamente.
					
					Pasando revista al campo deportivo, instruyo acondicionar la pista para carrera, tender cespedes artificiales en el suelo de la cancha de futbol y construir nuevamente las facilidades deportivas donde puedan realizar las actividades deportivas tales como el voleibol y baloncesto.
					
					Y enseno colgar las consignas como "!No tenemos que envidiar nada a nadie!", "!El General al frente y los ninos al campamento!" y otras que transmiten el amor del Presidente y el Dirigente por las generaciones venideras.
					
					En la playa, asevero que es necesario colocar  guardarropas, tabla de salto y modernas instalaciones de ducha y tomar las medidas para evitar el acopio de arenas en la playa.
					
					Tomo las medidas de acondicionar nuevamente el patio de educacion y pavimentar otra vez las aceras y senalo que enviaria los medios de transporte necesarios a la gestion del campamento.
					
					En esta ocasion, el Mariscal fue acompanado por el primer subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Hwi, y los subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Thae Song y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Ofrecido banquete en honor de campeones mundiales
articles.content:
Ofrecido banquete en honor de campeones mundiales
						
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 31 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete en honor de Kim Hyok Bong y Kim Jong, quienes conquistaron medalla de oro en el doble mixto del 52o Campeonato Mundial de Ping-Pong de la Federacion Internacional de Ping-Pong, y su entrenador Kim Chol Ung.
					En la recepcion participaron el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Deportes Ri Jong Mu, los funcionarios interesados, jugadores y familiares de medallistas.
					
					Kim Yong Jin, en su discurso de felicitacion, dio calurosa bienvenida a los campeones mundiales quienes dignificaron a la Corea del Songun con la medalla de oro.
					
					El exito logrado por ellos es una manifestacion clara de la justeza y vitalidad de la politica del PTC sobre el deporte y estimulo mucho a todo el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos movilizados en la construccion de Estado prospero socialista, apunto.
					
					Destaco que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un dispenso grandes beneficios a los jugadores y el entrenador quienes honraron a la patria con su victoria en el Campeonato Mundial de Ping-Pong.
					
					Enfatizo que todos los deportistas deben apoyar el partido y hacer brillar la patria con mucho mas medallas de oro.
					
					Kim Jong, en su discurso de respuesta, expreso agradecimiento al Mariscal quien hizo favor especial a ellos que cumplieron simplemente con su mision de deportista de la epoca del Songun.
					
					Juro responder con mayores exitos en competencias a la benevolencia y confianza del Mariscal.

articles.title: Colocadas ofrendas florales ante la tumba de Ri Po Ik
articles.content:
Colocadas ofrendas florales ante la tumba de Ri Po Ik
						
Pyongyang, 31 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 137o aniversario del natalicio de Ri Po Ik, abuela del Presidente Kim Il Sung, fueron depositadas este viernes las ofrendas florales ante su tumba en Mangyongdae. 
					Alli estaba colocada una ofrenda floral enviada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea. 
					
					En la ceremonia de homenaje participaron Kim Ki Nam, Yang Hyong Sop, Mun Kyong Dok, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales y los trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					Ante la tumba fueron puestas las ofrendas florales en nombre del Comite Central del PTC, las entidades de masas, los ministerios, los organos centrales, las academias militares, las instituciones de educacion, prensa e informacion, los organismos del partido y el poder y granjas de esta capital.
